title: Fast sync always 6000 blocks behind for more than 1 day
body:
I just want to sync a new node. So I copied the block data from a synced node to another vps and started syncing yesterday. However the syncing process seems extreamely slow, around 2 or 3 blocks per minute, so it should never catch up :(
I have tried several different version of geth including the latest 1.9.11, but no luck, the problem remains the same. Now I am using 1.9.10.

The sync out put:

Are you using an SSD? Geth does a **lot** of disk IO during syncing. Also when you start Geth, the caches are cold, so blocks are slower. Btw, how much memory allowance did you give it?

I set --cache=512. I think it's not the issue. Because I am currently running several ETH nodes for our mining pool, most of them are working on the vps with same system specification(CPU, mem etc...). Just this one has such syncing problem, now it's around 1 day 5 hours behind, never catch up.

The difference is I copied the block data from another synced node. I guess I may have to run a completely 'new' start, no short cut :(

> INFO [02-25|20:50:21.171] Imported new chain segment               blocks=1 txs=98  mgas=9.958  elapsed=19.420s   mgasps=0.513 number=9544910 hash=16ce44…d4f18a age=1d4h58m dirty=64.48MiB

Are you really sure the others are running with so little cache allowances? I'm pretty sure Geth cannot handle mainnet with only 512MB RAM. The defaults for mainnet at 4GB.

Also you seem to already be running the miner all while the node is still syncing, which is quite a significant extra load. You should first make sure the node is synced before attaching miners to it.

The ram is 4GB, and now there is around 2 GB free. What I mean is I am using the parameter  '--cache=512', the same as other nodes of mine currently running. 
I not sure why the mining started, the mining process should abort automatically until it's synced.
Anyway, I removed the '--mine' from parameter 1 hour ago, and started syncing again, but nothing improved

@rlinxy Have you finished your sync process?
Yes, seems it was a bug with previous version.
